all_plans.title: Gym Back Muscle Focus Plan (Lite)

exercises.name: Light Treadmill Walk
instructions: Walk at a comfortable pace to increase blood flow
Maintain good posture with shoulders back
exercises.reason: Warm-up to prepare muscles and joints for strength work, especially important before breakfast for diabetic management
safety_notes: Monitor blood sugar if possible
Stop if feeling lightheaded

exercises.name: Lat Pulldown
instructions: Sit with knees under pads, grip bar wider than shoulders
Pull bar down to chest, squeezing shoulder blades together
Control the weight back up
exercises.reason: Primary compound exercise to target major back muscles (lats) as requested by the user
safety_notes: Avoid using momentum; use controlled movements
Do not arch back excessively

exercises.name: Seated Cable Row
instructions: Sit with knees slightly bent, grasp handle with neutral grip
Pull handle to abdomen, squeezing shoulder blades
Extend arms forward with control
exercises.reason: Targets middle back and improves posture, complementing the lat pulldown
safety_notes: Keep back straight, avoid rounding shoulders
Exhale on the pull, inhale on the return

exercises.name: Back Extension (Hyperextension)
instructions: Position hips on pad, feet secured
Cross arms over chest
Lower torso slowly, then raise back to a straight line with body
exercises.reason: Isolates and strengthens the lower back muscles, providing a comprehensive back workout
safety_notes: Do not hyperextend past a straight back
Move slowly to avoid strain

exercises.name: Standing Cat-Cow Stretch
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart
Inhale, arch back and look up slightly (Cow)
Exhale, round spine and tuck chin (Cat)
Repeat slowly
exercises.reason: Cool-down stretch to improve spinal mobility and release tension in the worked back muscles
safety_notes: Move within a pain-free range
Focus on breathing

all_plans.reasoning: This plan strictly follows the user's request for a gym-based back muscle workout. It includes a brief cardio warm-up, three key strength exercises targeting different areas of the back (lats, middle back, lower back), and a flexibility cool-down. The intensity is set to moderate for an intermediate level, duration is 30 minutes, and total calories meet the 150 kcal target. The session is scheduled before breakfast as requested, with safety considerations for diabetes (monitoring, low-intensity start).
safety_notes: Consult physician before starting any new exercise program.
If diabetic, monitor blood glucose before and after exercise, especially when fasted.
Maintain proper form to prevent back injury. Start with light weights.
Stay hydrated.

recommendations: Start gradually and listen to your body
Stop immediately if you experience pain or discomfort
Stay hydrated before, during, and after exercise
Consult healthcare provider before starting due to: diabetes
